title: Isa's Turtle
description: I made this for one of my best friends. She has a tortise and wanted me to make a stuffed one for her newborn neice.

title: Beckhams Dino
description: I made this for my nephew who was going through a dino phase. I LOVE this pattern, it turned out sooo cute and the video was easy to follow.
difficulty: Not to hard with the video to follow

title: Oakley's Lovey
description: I made this for a friend who had a baby girl. It was freehanded, but not difficult when combining what I knew about making stuffed animals and blankets.

title: Lovely Piggy
description: This was a fun project I did and gave to a friend for Valentines Day. It was a good experinment for me with crocheting different shapes.

title: Capped and Scalloped
description: This was the thinest yarn I had ever used up to this point and it was pretty slick. It ended up working well for this project because it was crocheted. It created a nice texture.

title: Ayla's Cardigan
description: This pattern should fit a baby around 4-6 months. Once I had the basics of clothing down it was an easy pattern to visualize and follow.

title: first Knit Polo
description: This pattern was super easy to follow, but it was my first knitting project so it took me a second to understand increasing and get used to how to hold needles. Video was super easy to follow though.

title: Ayla's Bonnet #1
description: My older sister loves a baby in a bonnet so I had to make her some. This was my first one. It's important to check sizing to make sure it will fit the intended age.
difficulty: Easy if you know how to do magic circles

title: Ayla's Bonnet and collar #2
description: I made this for my niece because my sister loves vintage looking baby stuff and I have to say I love the way it turned out.
